summary: Eugene Milligan is identified as the Chief of CCS/GLOBE. A memo from Milligan to the Office of the General Counsel addresses questions regarding Thomas Lee Roberts' relationship with Herbert Itkin and the Conestoga Group. The memo clarifies when LPGLOBE became aware of their proposal to Roberts. The documents suggest Milligan's role involves handling inquiries and providing clarifications related to individuals and groups connected to the CIA and FBI, specifically in the context of the Herbert Itkin case.
significance: Eugene Milligan's significance lies in his role as Chief of CCS/GLOBE and his involvement in addressing questions and providing clarifications related to individuals and groups connected to the CIA and FBI, specifically in the context of the Herbert Itkin case. The Itkin case appears to be of interest to the CIA.
